column2: KENTUCKY DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: Kentucky

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. The side mirror(s) should be set so when you lean left/right you:
column4: can barely see the side of your vehicle.
column6: can see half of your vehicle.
column8: can't see your vehicle.

column2: 2. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Do not block intersection
column8: Flagger ahead

column2: 4. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 5. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: riding the pedal lightly.
column6: having them checked by a mechanic.
column8: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.

column2: 6. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.

column2: 7. You should increase your following distance:
column4: at night or if it is raining.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 8. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the left.
column6: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the right.

column2: 9. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that are easy to spot.
column8: areas of the road that cannot be seen even when looking into mirrors.

column2: 10. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: Pull the steering wheel back.

column2: 11. The picture shows:
column4: a speeding fines doubled sign.
column8: a railroad advance warning sign.

column2: 12. Collisions can happen more often when:
column4: one vehicle is traveling faster than the flow of traffic.
column6: all vehicles are traveling at the posted speed limit.
column8: one lane of traffic is traveling faster than the others.

column2: 13. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 14. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.
column8: pump your brakes.

column2: 15. Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
column4: Tranquilizers and sedatives.
column6: Cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 16. If an emergency vehicle with flashing lights is traveling in the area where you are driving, you must:
column4: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column8: proceed slowly and let the vehicle pass.

column2: 17. If a pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green, you should:
column4: proceed because you have the right-of-way.
column6: wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.
column8: proceed unless the pedestrian is in your lane.

column2: 18. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column4: speedgating.
column8: tailgating.

column2: 19. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column6: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column8: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.

column2: 20. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
column4: School zone
column8: Yield

column2: 21. If your vehicle is equipped with ABS and you need to stop quickly, you should:
column4: press on the brake pedal as hard as you can and keep pressing on it.
column6: gently apply the brakes and hold the steering wheel firmly.
column8: press hard on the brakes, then let up on the brake pedal.

column2: 22. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 23. Motorcycles:
column4: are entitled to use a complete traffic lane.
column6: are easier to see than cars.
column8: must share a traffic lane with another vehicle.

column2: 24. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column4: Pentagon
column8: Crossbuck

column2: 25. Roads are the most slippery:
column4: the first rain after a dry spell.
column6: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.
column8: after it has been raining for an hour or more.

column2: 26. You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
column4: on the entrance ramp.
column8: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.

column2: 27. A red arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.
column6: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
column8: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.

column2: 28. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column6: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.
column8: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.

column2: 29. The driver is about to:
column4: turn right.
column8: stop.

column2: 30. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are not allowed to park here.
column6: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column8: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.

column2: 31. If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you should treat the intersection the same as:
column4: a yield sign.
column8: a stop sign.

column2: 32. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column4: Before the crosswalk.
column8: Before the stop line.

column2: 33. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 34. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column4: exceed the speed limit
column8: All of the above.

column2: 35. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column6: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 36. Speed limit signs are:
column4: regulation signs (regulatory signs)
column8: warning signs

column2: 37. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Honk your horn.
column6: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column8: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.

column2: 38. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column6: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column8: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 39. If you become sleepy while driving you should:
column4: get some rest or change drivers.
column8: drink coffee.

column2: 40. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column6: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column8: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
